org.json

Class JSONStrictTokener

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.json.Scanner
      • org.json.JSONTokener
        • org.json.JSONStrictTokener

  • public class JSONStrictTokener
extends JSONTokener
    A JSONStrictTokener takes a source stream and extracts characters and tokens from it. It is used by the JSONObject and JSONArray constructors to parse JSON source streams as strictly according to the specification as possible.

    For a lenient parse, use JSONTokener.

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Method Detail

      • nextClean

        public char nextClean()
               throws JSONException
        Get the next char in the stream, skipping insignificant whitespace. Control characters less than U+0020, apart from newline and carriage return, result in an error.
        Overrides:
        nextClean in class JSONTokener
        Returns:
        A character, or 0 if there are no more characters.
        Throws:
        JSONException - there was a problem tokenizing the JSON text

      • nextTokenType

        public JSONTokener.JSONToken nextTokenType()
                                    throws JSONException
        Get the type of the next token in the stream, skipping whitespace. This parses the literal separators only.
        Overrides:
        nextTokenType in class JSONTokener
        Returns:
        the Token type representing the next token type
        Throws:
        JSONException
        See Also:
        JSONTokener.JSONToken

      • nextString

        public java.lang.String nextString(char quote)
                            throws JSONException
        Return the characters up to the next close quote character. Backslash processing is done. The formal JSON format only allows strings in double quotes.
        Overrides:
        nextString in class JSONTokener
        Parameters:
        quote - The quoting character, must be " (double quote).
        Returns:
        A String.
        Throws:
        JSONException - Unterminated string.

      • nextKey

        public java.lang.String nextKey()
                         throws JSONException
        Get the next key. This must be a quoted String value.
        Overrides:
        nextKey in class JSONTokener
        Returns:
        An object.
        Throws:
        JSONException - If syntax error.

      • nextValue

        public java.lang.Object nextValue()
                           throws JSONException
        Get the next value. The value can be a Boolean, Double, Integer, JSONArray, JSONObject, Long, or String, or the JSONObject.NULL object.
        Overrides:
        nextValue in class JSONTokener
        Returns:
        An object.
        Throws:
        JSONException - If syntax error.
